fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2665].
  {panel}

I want to be able to customise the information shown on screen by the filter views. What would be realy handy would be to show the date an issue was last modified or commented on and possibly the name of the user to last comment on it or modify it.

Also I want to change the filter I've got showing work assigned to individual users to only show work assigned to them that was NOT last changed by or commented on by them.

Is there any way either of these two tasks can be achieved in the current system or am I going top have to wait for a system upgrade???

Iwas asked to create this issue and link it to JRA-1907
fields.summary: Customising filter views

fields.description:
At the moment there is no way to get from the project administration section of JIRA to the Browse Project page.

I think it would make sense to add Browse Project as a link next to Edit Project and Delete Project ?

Also if we create a Browse Version page, then next to every version in the list we should have Browse (as well as Delete | Rename)

fields.description:
When entering new issues with Scheduling turned on, the 'due date' format is frequently a cause of pain. It is hardcoded to d-MMM-yyyy (in CreateIssueDetails.java), a format that is universally unintuitive, and this cannot be changed without recompiling JIRA.

A catch is that the due date picker needs to work, no matter what the date format is.
fields.summary: Date format should be customizable

fields.description:
Some people are getting warnings on startup:

2003-11-10 16:04:10,843 WARN [atlassian.jira.security.PermissionsCache] Could not add permission Permission:
[type=22][scheme=null][group=etg-administrators][permType=group] - it already existed?

It doesn't appear to cause problems, but is probably a symptom of something that needs fixing.

Data donations to support@ from people experiencing this welcome :)
fields.summary: "Could not add permission: ... it already existed?" warning on startup

fields.description:
When doing bulk editing, i would expect to be able to add a comment to all the edited issues (as done when editing a single issue) explaining the change.

At the moment this is not possible, it seems.

The easiest way would be to have an "add comment" option in the step 2 (choose options) of the bulk editing. This would also allow "bulk commenting" issues.
fields.summary: Ability to add comments during bulk editing

fields.description: When a user tried to create an issue, manually typing in the due date field, he typed it in the standard US format (MM/DD/YY), which is unrecognized by JIRA. The issue was refused by the system and the page reloaded, but there wasn't an error indicating a problem with the date format. In the end, we used the date picker window to get the right format and everything worked out.
fields.summary: Create New Issue - Due Date Error

fields.description:
It would be nice if we could filter on component(s) when launching the developer workload report.

There are probably other fields (ie component) that make sense to filter on.

In fact, it would be even more interesting to also have the report results broken down by version(s) (other fields?).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2644].
  {panel}

One thing that is currently causing us problems is the "one size fits all" Notification Scheme's that are in JIRA. Although you can define varying scheme's per project, and using watches people can decide if they want to be notified about a certain issue ... People here want to be able to do similar but at a higher level - be the execption to the scheme's rule.

For example:

I set groupA to be notified whenever an issue is created in projectA. This is fine, however [without admin intervention (adding them to groupA or singularly), but with "overriding approval" (eg: 'tick here to allow users to override notifications on this project')] I would like to be able to have a user decide him/herself if they get the notifications for issue creation.

The same applies to all the various issue notification options (eg: issue closing, assigning, work logging etc).

This idea is extensible and leads to create a scalable (overridable) notification scheme which is managed by the end users (if the option is enabled) rather than needing and administration team to get involved in notifications when they should be focused on security and auditing.
fields.summary: Notifications Customisable by End Users

fields.description:
Email addresses are case insensitive, therefore the user browser filter should perform a case insensitive search on email addresses. Most people use lower case characters in their email address, but some use upper case letters too, and currently they are very difficult to find.

In addition, "filter by username" and "filter by fullname" fields would be very useful. Many users have strange and not intuitive email addresses. Our administrator knows persons by their full name, not necessarily by their email address.
fields.summary: User browser filter needs case insensitive search and more options

fields.description: When projects were not associated with a non-default field layout scheme the cache was not looked up properly causing many unneeded database look ups.

This is useful when the database is edited "manually" (or with external tools), to ensure that the database is left in a consistent state.

We should improve the way that icons are placed - as the look pretty cool!

fields.description:
When you add a custom column to the issue navigator, if there is a space in your data, then the column breaks across multiple lines.

For example, we have a column to track the name of the person that submitted an issue for use when the user creating the issue is not the user that requested the change. The first and last names are displayed on seperate lines in the issue navigator.

However, I can imagine another instance when you would want the columns to expand to multiple lines, so I'm not sure how this could be handled.
fields.summary: Custom column in issue navigator wraps

fields.description: If you add a custom column to the issue navigator display, it displays with a different font (and possibly size) than the rest of the columns.
fields.summary: Custom columns in issue navigator have different font

fields.description:
We are using the Non Quoted Comment Handler with the ImapService. If someone has a "vacation" message set, the first email they get from JIRA will be responded to with the "vacation" message which then ends up in a comment on some issue.

Some way to avoid these messages getting added would be nice (like a regex filter used to reject messages).
fields.summary: CommentHandlers should filter out vacation email messages

fields.description:
Would it be possible to put the attachment dialog additionally into Step 2 of 2 of the CREATE NEW ISSUE DIALOG?

After creating a new issue it is extra work to additionally start the attachment dialog in order to attach files.

I think that it would be more efficient (if technically possible) to offer this with the Create New Issue dialog.

Cheers
fields.summary: Separate attachment dialog vs. inbound  dialog in CREATE NEW ISSUES dialog

fields.description:
The "Available Worklflow Actions" menu on the left hand side (dependent on permission scheme) is not part of the i18n (internationalisation) e.g using German as the standard language the entries do still show up in English. 

Q:
1.Why?

2.I found out that the entries for the menu are placed in the 
jira-worklflow.xml (C:\atlassian-jira-professional-2.5-standalone-tomcat\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\jira-workflow.xml).

Would it be a viable solution to change the entries there or would I have to fear side effects?

3.Should the jira-worklflow.xml be mentioned in the manual in the applicable part concerning i18n?

Cheers.
fields.summary: Available Worklflow Actions not part of i18n

fields.description:
USE CASE:
QA reopens a bug, that a developer has previously resolved with "Fixed". (The developer is this bug's assignee.)

EXPECTED:
The developer sees this bug in both, his HOME page under "Open issues assigned to me", and in the resp. project under "Open issues by assignee".

REAL:
The bug is not displayed on the user's HOME page, but only in the resp. project under "Open issues by assignee".

ANNOTATION:
It seems, that on the home page only "new" issues are displayed, whereas on the project page "new" and "reopened" issues are displayed.
fields.summary: Reopend issue is not displayed in user's home page

fields.description:
The German translation provided with version 2.5 is awful (1 to 1 translations and no good German).

E.G. "HOME" always stays "HOME" even in German (any user knows what "HOME" is). The German translation says "ZENTRALE" which means "CENTRAL".

It's very hard to translate "issue" in German (in the JIRA context). In the official version the translation is "FALL" which means case. I'd prefer the word "EINTRAG" which means entry (and is a better translation releated to "issue").

I know I can replace this with my own version but then I have to this with every new version.

I did my own translation with version 2.5 beta2 and it was much better.

Forget about typos, this can  happen.
fields.summary: Correct ugly German translation

fields.description:
Tasks are often not only to be done by one person, but by one team.

Thus I would appreciate, if a task could be assigned either to a single jira-user or to a user defined group.
fields.summary: Assign a task to a user OR A GROUP

fields.summary: cannot get to startup wizard if tomcat is already installed/configured

fields.description:
A historical view of the report in JRA-2608.

Example

                Days Spent on all tasks
                ========================

                10Oct03    11Oct03    12Oct03 ...
Smith             10         10.5      12
Jones             15         17        17     ...
.
.
.
fields.summary: Historical Activity Report - (implies development velocity)

fields.description: To measure development velocity I generate a report using Pivot tables in Excel. Can I do this directly in Jira. Please see attached for an exmaple of how I envisage the report to look like.
fields.summary: Pivot Table like report

fields.description:
Currently, I can create a filter like this:
"current user is reporter AND assignee."

I would appreciate also to create filters with OR conditions like "current user is reporter OR assignee".
fields.summary: Would like to create a filter also with OR conditions

fields.description:
Currently I must know who is the responsible developer of a component, if I don't want to assign all the project's issues to the lead developer.

I would appreciate, if I could assign a user to a project's component as responsible for that component,
If a create a new issue for that component, this user is suggested by default as the assignee of this issue.
fields.summary: Would like to assign a user to a component as responsible

fields.description:
When creating an issue, when an invalid date is entered in the Due Date field, there is no error message - the page just refreshes.

This is particularly annoying because the date format is hardcoded to something weird like d-M-yyyy, easy to get wrong.
fields.summary: Due Date field error checking is broken

fields.description:
This appears to be an orion-specific bug. The workaround at the moment is to change the global default locale in the admin section to the language you want JIRA to appear in. 

We'll schedule the investigation and fixing of this bug for some future release. 

Cheers, 
Dave
fields.summary: Top navigational bar is not internationalized under Orion

fields.description: The online docs at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/ ought to be searchable.  There is some preliminary lucene support in CVS Forrest - need to try this locally.
fields.summary: Make documentation searchable

fields.description:
I tried using the 2.5-b2 package and I got some errors about some missing libraries [which I will attach after creating this message].  When I ran the 2.5-b2 standalone version it worked fine.  Eventually I got the 2.5-b2 package to work by copying the WEB-INF/lib contents of the standalone package to the WEB-INF/lib of the non-standalone package.  

JIRA version is JIRA 2.5-b2 Enterprise.
fields.summary: Library Inconsistencies

fields.description: At SSI we got some intranet tools running like TWiki, a bulleting board, a CVS web interface etc. They all have the same look and feel and links in the header. I want to be able to put my own HTML code in the header of JIRA to have a seamless integration.
fields.summary: Want to be able to set headline of interface

fields.description: When creating a task I want to be able to set some (zero, one or multiple) watchers for this task. E.g. if I assign a task as unit manager to a worker, and also want his group manager to be notified and informed.
fields.summary: Want to be able to set watcher

fields.description:
If I enter a comment that contains a URL enclosed in <>, the closing '>' is subsequently treated as part of the URL.  See for example http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=HB-380 wherein 'JSQLFeatures.html>' was originally entered as 'JSQLFeatures.html>'.

The closing '>' should be recognized as a non-URL punctuation character, marking the end of the URL.

Here's a similar example: these two URLs should be identical:
http://yahoo.com
<http://yahoo.com>
fields.summary: URL parser doesn't stop at >

fields.description:
At SSI we have the following use case:
Someone with a problem calls into service, and service creates the bug/task in Jira and assigns the bug to a colleague who is working on the problem. So we have the following three roles:
- Caller / Describer (or whatever the name of the role is)
- Reporter (someone who creates the bug in Jira)
- Asignee (someone who fixes the bug)

All three want information what work is done on the task. Everybody is known as use to JIRA, but the caller/describer could also be an outside person.

Solution could be:
a.) I am able to set manually the reporter, so I could report a task in the name of someone else.
b.) I get an additional list selection for the caller/describer role
fields.summary: Want to be able to set reporter or have additional field

fields.description:
Have had some troubles with user and group management.

1) Created some groups for enforcing project-specific permissions
2) Changed my mind about the names of the groups, so created new names which were very similar to the originals
3) Entered user management for a user, Joined the new group
4) Tried to Leave the old group, but the group list did not update

After trying a number of different things (different browsers, logout and login), decided to remove that user and start again:
5) My browser went back to User Browser with the user still there

Interestingly:
6) When rechecking the details before sending this issue, the user is now in NO groups
7) Trying to Join any groups, the user's Groups are not changed
fields.summary: Unable to delete some users and groups

fields.description: The maven-user list seems to get quite a few people complaining that when they try to create an issue in JIRA, maven is not available as a project. Perhaps the create issue JSP could be edited to include something along the lines of: "Certain projects require you to log in to create an issue. If the porject you are looking for is not listed, please log in or sign up for a new account if you need one". This might need to be more generic to details that you need certain permissions. From my experience with JIRA, there are a few places where it does things "magically" because of permissions that cvan be confusing to work out. eg due date not appearing on the create form because of permissions. It would be better to be present but disabled/greyed if it is enabled for the project but not for the current user.

This makes it very difficult to debug problems with them.

In particular, we need the src snapshot of the Webwork that you are shipping to fix the problem with Jira on Websphere.

It would be good to have these src snapshots for each version of Jira.

fields.summary: Usernames are not ordered alphabetically in "Assign to:" pulldown

fields.description:
So here appears to be a problem and i am not exactly sure who is responsible for what as I haven't checked the new Servlet 2.4 specs yet.

I have been trying to setup JIRA on Resin's new 3.0.4 (well, the latest snapshot as of Nov. 3rd, 2003).  Resin now support 2.4 servlet specs and also the new JSP specs.  

There were some bugs with Resin that were causing Jira not to run properly.  However, those have now been fixed.  Currently, I am experiencing a problem where the output of the JSP pages are mangled and not being output in the order they are supposed to.

After going through some interaction with caucho/resin support, it appears that the new Servlet/JSP spec might require calling flush when including a JSP page, something like:

<jsp:include page="/blah.jsp" flush="true"/>

I am not sure if this is supposedly the new way of dealing with flushing, but from the bug reports, this is what it said:

Unfortunately, the JSP 2.0 spec has essentially forbidden the seamless include() that Resin was able to do without the flush(). Now, you'll need to flush the output before an include. 


Would it be possible that this is now a Jira issue?  Should Jira flush the <jsp:include> pages?  

I am going to test some more and see what happens, but it is rather disconcerting.. sigh.

Chris
fields.summary: Jira Running on Resin 3.0.x is causing output to be mangled

fields.description:
At the moment you can only schedule one version at once. It would be useful if you could select multiple versions at once, as this makes the overall scheduling process much more efficient.

For example, if you have 2, 3, 1 and you want the order to be 1, 2, 3 - you need to select 1 and click 'up' twice.

It would be more useful to select 2 and 3, and click 'down' once.
fields.summary: Scheduling versions improvement

fields.description:
Unlike linking, would like to be able to thread individual requirements or tests that make up an issue and which all rollup to make a single issue (in this case an improvement or new feature).  

For example, we often track change requests for new features or improvements in our project mgmt project.  Would like to have the ability to thread each new requirement which must be met to make up the new feature/improvement. Would like this to have a single numbering scheme but with the ability to track the individual requirements which make up the overall new feature/requirement for reporting purposes.
fields.summary: Ability to do issue threading for the purpose of tracking individual requirements or tests that are spawned from an original issue
Ability to copy issues from one project to another but with the ability to perform maintenance on one which updates both copies

fields.description:
My understanding of the current workflow scheme is that the workflow can be defined for the app as a whole.  

My need is that we use projects in Jira differently - some as defect tracking, some as project mgmt, some as help desk mgmt; thus, I have a need to customize the workflow by project and sometimes by issue type within the project.  I may also need the ability to define certain users/user groups (which I setup by a dummy user name) as the recipient of certain issues when they reach a certain status.  I've not found any documentation that indicates that you currently do this but would appreciate it if you did!!
fields.summary: Ability to configure the workflow by project or issue type

fields.description:
It would be interesting to be able to send a notification to users who have a given permission on the target project.

For example add a notification to user who can : Administer Projects.

This can be somewhat achieved by using a notification to a group but then you have to create a different notification scheme for all projects.

fields.summary: Set radio button for remaining work estimate when entered

fields.description: Pretty much as in the summary.  Sometimes you log work to the wrong issue, or the wrong time etc.  You could edit it I guess, but a delete would be easiest.

fields.description:
I am the site admin for Jira at our location.

Users complained to me that they could not log in. I found that, by bouncing the Jira server, I could get *limited* ability to log in as myself or "admin" for a while. Then, after a few attempts, neither I nor my users could log in any more.

During my testing today, the logs do not show any errors. I looked at the older log entries and found the following, which may or may not be related:

2003-10-31 12:39:14 StandardManager[] Cannot serialize session attribute os_security_defaultauthent
icator_user for session 21353CAA23EA12A804466A0B01B115FF
java.io.NotSerializableException: org.apache.log4j.Logger
        at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject0(ObjectOutputStream.java:1054)
        at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.defaultWriteFields(ObjectOutputStream.java:1330)
        ...

I tried moving away the "work/" subdirectory of the application server, thinking that there may be serialized sessions which need to be re-created in order to avoid the above problem. This caused the application to consistently give me the error:

org.apache.jasper.JasperException: For input string: "null"
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:254)
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:295)
        at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:241)
        .....

and now, even though I moved the original "work/" dir back into the application server, I keep getting the above error.
fields.summary: Errors logging into Jira

fields.description:
The "All Projects" portlet and the "Project" portlet when "Project Information:" is set to "Full" displays a bar graph dividing the open issues by prioity.

Unfortunately these statistics potentially violate the the issue level security.  

The "Project Statistics" portlet , when set to priority shows only the issues a users has the priviledge to see.

Problem 1.  These two portlets are suppose to showing the same data, but can be diffent.
Problem 2.  Hovering over a section, the pop-up could say "3-Medium 74% 77 issues",  but clicking on that section returns 12 issues, because the other have an Issue level security that you don't have permission to see.

Inflict this problem by 
1. User A setting  "All Projects" portlet "Project Information:" to "Full" 
2. User B setting an Issue's issue level security to a setting that User A doesn't fall into
fields.summary: Bars in Projects portlet shows stats for hidden issues

fields.description:
The "created" and "updated" columns in the issue navigator show very strage data:

31.35.03
31.33.03

etc.

Should probably be "31.10.03". The detail views of the bugs are different, but still wrong: "31. Oct 03 08:35". This should really be "31. Oct 03 20:35".

I am running the professional version on the same server (and tomcat) which does not show this bug. That date format looks like "24/Oct/03 04:57 PM".

I have no idea why the enterprise version shows different date/time strings than the professional version. Both setups are the same, at least I can't remember changing any date related parameters.
fields.summary: garbage in some date fields

Thanks

fields.description:
We typically utilize JIRA in way that has a few main projects that are accessed by internal developers (using Permission Scheme A) and some projects that external developers access (using Permission Scheme B). 

At the colclusion of the (external) projects, we would like to fold all of the issues from that project into one of the main (internal) projects.

Currently there is a way to move individual issues - it would be great if there were a way to move a number of issues at once or even move one entire project to another project.
fields.summary: Would like a way to consolidate projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2565].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 19 March 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

This is a routine update of this issue. We hope to address JIRA's notification system with more customizable notifications, but we do not currently have a timeframe of when this effort will begin. Please continue to pass along your suggestions for notifications.

As always, please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Thanks
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently, the notification schemes are pretty good - and cover what most people want.

However, what would be very useful is to be able to define some rules for more complex notification schemes.

For example, you may want to notify a particular group on a particular event based on some data in the issue - predicatable data like version, component, value of some custom field.

Something like:

CustomField.Location="London"
Component="Workflow"

-Nick
fields.summary: Rule-based Notification Schemes
Use Javascript to lowercase usernames on login - it would save some login hassles
Move link comments to "Issue Links:" field

fields.description:

"Form Errors: 
An exception occurred: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: isHasIssuePermission can only take an Issue: Project is not.. "

I've checked the permissions, and I have permission to enter a Due Date, so why would this be happening?  If I load the issue with out the Due Date, I can then Edit the issue and enter a Due Date, but this makes more work.
fields.summary: Can't add issue when a due date is loaded
